data.title: Disappointed in Renee Allen's Mac & Cheese & More
data.text: When this take-out soul food place first opened in Apple Valley, CA, the food was absolutely delicious!  All my doctors and the laboratory are in Apple Valley and I'd stop in Renee Allen's Mac & Cheese to buy a meal for my lunch.   Sometimes, I'd even specifically drive to Apple Valley to buy my lunch at Renee Allen's.  However, eventually the delicious collard greens were no longer delicious.  They were under-cooked and not properly seasoned.  The mac & cheese also lost its quality.  It was no longer creamy and rich and a little on the watery side.  I stopped going there for a while.  When I finally went back just before the business moved to Victorville, I felt that, overall, the food was no longer the quality it was when the take-out opened its business.  One of my friends stopped at the new location and she said the food was terrible.  I'm searching for another great soul food restaurant.  I don't recommend this place.

data.title: Terrible
data.text: So I tried this place this week because I had heard nothing but good things from people about it. Unfortunately, it was terrible.  Soul food is my favorite type of food, so I could not have been more disappointed.  I ordered the Fried Red Snapper. The meat was dry and it tasted like they forgot to add seasoning. My side was Mac n' Cheese, which was horrible. Tasted like someone dumped nothing but black pepper into it. I also had greens. The greens were actually pretty amazing and the best part of the meal. I also had cornbread, which also lacked flavor. My husband had Fried Chicken. The chicken was cooked perfectly, however it also tasted like they had forgot to season it.  He ordered pinto beans, which had been overcooked and looked more like refried beans. The meal for 2 of us was $30. This was a big waste of money due to the poor quality of the food.  I would not ever go back.

data.title: dining
data.text: I wanted to try this place, i had heard such good things about it. I was disappointed because the Mac and Cheese was not wonderful, i would of preffered the Kraft to theirs. They brushed bbq sauce on the meat i tried to make you feel as it you got BBQ'd meat, it clearly wasn't barbequed. Nothing that i ate didn't thrill me. I wouldn't return to her area. But some people like her food, and more power to them.

data.title: Amazing Food & Owners.. Nutrition Edge Owner
data.text: Well let's just say I had them deliver my order on a Friday Night,had the "Fried Chicken Dinner. Went Back on Saturday afternoon and took my employee, she had the pulled Pork, I had The Ribs. Went Back Sunday Afternoon took my Mother and Partner We all had The "Fried Chicken Dinner" What More can I Say I LOVE THIS PLACE !!!!

data.title: Best fried Chicken
data.text: A small little station restaurant all by itself . Nothing fancy here except the exceptional cuisine.The fried chicken is seasoned just right and made to order . Just what you would expect ,crispy coated outside tender and juicy  inside .Really the best I have ever had . The collard greens are simply great with that certain spicy touch and not overdone or meaty . Very delectable ! Of course great mac n cheese . If you get the time stop by before 8pm ,You will be glad you did

data.title: Renee Allen's Mac & Cheese
data.text: I was very familiar with Renee Allen's original location in Apple Valley that they grew out of. They leased a new space in the last year in Downtown Victorville and 2 of us stopped by today for a quick Sunday lunch. They were hitting it out of the park. I had the Fried Chicken with Cole Slaw and Collard greens. They were incredible. I was happy to see 27 others in the restaurant, and somewhat surprised because it was a Sunday and Old Town Victorville is usually quiet. The restaurant is an exceptional addition to Old Town Victorville. I look forward to many other meals.
